revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Election | election_name = United States Senate elections, 1916 | country = United States | flag_year = 1912 | type = legislative | ongoing = no | previous_election = United States Senate elections, 1914 | previous_year = 1914 | next_election = United States Senate elections, 1918 | next_year = 1918 | seats_for_election = 35 of the 96 seats in the [[United States Senate]] | majority_seats = 49 | election_date = November 7, 1916 | image2 = | party2 = Republican Party (United States) | last_election2 = 40 seats | seats2 = 42 | seat_change2 = +2 | popular_vote2 = | percentage2 = | swing2 = | image1 = | party1 = Democratic Party (United States) | last_election1 = 56 seats | seats1 = 54 | seat_change1 = -2 | popular_vote1 = | percentage1 = | swing1 = | title = Majority Party | before_election = Democratic Party (United States) | after_election = Republican Party (United States) }} The '''U.S. Senate election, 1916''' was an election that coincided with the re-election of Democratic President [[Woodrow Wilson]]. Republicans gained a net pick-up of two seats from the Democrats. Republicans picked up seven seats: * [[Harry S. New]] (IN) * [[James E. Watson]] (IN)--won in a special election * [[Frederick Hale]] (ME) * [[Joseph I. France]] (MD) * [[Joseph S. Freylinghuysen]] (NJ) * [[William M. Calder]] (NY) * [[Howard Sutherland]] (WV) Democrats picked up five seats: * [[Josiah O. Wolcott]] (DE) * [[Andrieus A. Jones]] (NM) * [[Peter G. Gerry]] (RI) * [[William H. King]] (UT) * [[John B. Kendrick]] (WY) == Complete list of races == '''Bold state''' indicates election article link. '''Bold candidate''' indicates winner. === Separate election === {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Date ! State ! Reason ! Incumbent ! Party ! Result ! Campbell]] (Prohibition), 0.45% |} == Senate Party Division, [[65th United States Congress|65th Congress]] (1917-1919) == Majority Party: Democratic (54 seats) Minority Party: Republican (42 seats) Other Parties: 0 Total Seats: 96 Note: These numbers represent composition as result of 1916 Senatorial Elections.
